pageContext.claim: “The electric [system in Puerto Rico] was broken before the storms. They got hit by two storms, not one... It didn't work. They had no electric.”
pageContext.analysis: Puerto Rico's electric utility had been providing spotty service in the period leading up to Hurricane Maria, but Trump and Rivera's claim is false. Nearly 96 percent of customers had power when Maria made landfall, according to the {Los Angeles Times}.
